intro: Metastelma cuneatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed metaphytes, is a member of the Araceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies. The botanical features of Metastelma cuneatum make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
